intro: Dactylus officinalis, commonly known as the medicinal dactylus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and pharmacology.
